conbody.p: Select this menu item to use a student's microphone as the source of broadcast, allowing other student to hear him or her during any activity. Any student can be selected as the source, even ones who are not affiliated with the current group.

The Student media source control tab ( ) has a Start button, a drop-down list of students, and three additional options: Record for students, Digitize and Listen (these options are described in section ).
Immediately below the Start button there is a clock displaying time elapsed since the student has been selected as the source of broadcast.
conbody.note: You can digitize and save student's voice for future use.

Using a Student from outside of the group as the media source one can easily organize interpretingsimultaneous interpreting into several languages. Associate the interpreters with the same group, e.g. group A. This group listens to the speaker. Each interpreter, in turn, is then selected as a source for another group of listeners. For example, in ( ) group B can listen to simultaneous interpretation of the speaker into Spanish, while group C can listen to the same in French.
